Key Arguments: The legislation would be detrimental to democracy in Australia.
It is discriminatory to give any organization the power to shut down individual opinions.
The legislation contradicts the Charter of Human Rights.
The government should not have total power over media discussions or impose fines.
The approach will decrease trust in the government and foster mistrust.
Notable Quotes: This bill if implemented would be detrimental to the Democratic way we in Australia have the privilege to live under.
It is totally discriminatory to give power to any organisation to shut down the right of an individual to express an opinion openly.
This authoritarian approach will decrease trust in our governments.
